Reviews.Title: “A solid choice if cost is your main concern”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDandy
Reviews.Content: CONDITIONS OF STAY: - 4 night stay in November of 2008 - 2nd trip to Rome - Reason for trip: Vacation FIRST IMPRESSIONS: As others of noted, the Piazza Cavour/Sant' Angelo area is easy to reach by public transportation. However, the hotel is a 3 to 5-minute walk from any drop-off point and with rolling luggage, this is not a comfortable walk to due sections of cobblestone and the typical narrow Roman sidewalks. This was the 1st trip to Rome with my now wife, and she was very uncomfortable wheeling her luggage, and her bag was rather small. The hotel itself, like many in Europe, is located in a building that houses other residences/businesses, ergo, it's a not solely dedicated to the hotel. This is fine, and often times charming, but you will be walking up stairs with your bags to reach reception or taking the tiny elevator to the proper floor. Checking in was easy, the service typically Italian and warm (the smaller, cheaper hotels always seem to have the best service for some reason). Reception is located in the same area as where you'd have breakfast. THE ROOM: As other travelers have noted, these rooms are bare bones and simple. But I should mention a few things. First, the rooms are BASIC, which is common for Rome in this price range (however, it should be noted you CAN find slightly more charming hotels in this price range, see the Domus Ester in Campo de Fiori). The rooms have hard tile floors. We noticed this led to movement by the bed when we used it as the bed did not have rubber feet to prevent this. This can be very awkward, to say the least. The bathrooms, as others have noted, are small, but again very typical. On the plus side, the room was very clean and had large windows with views onto the street, and this being Rome, most views are interesting. Also, it is quiet given the quiet nature of the neighborhood. THE LOCATION: I have stayed in this area twice on vacation in Rome (due to the prices) and afterwards lived and worked there. Many people on here talk about the location being only 10 or 20 minutes from major sights by foot. But coming from a family that has members with disabilities, and now having lived very close to here, there are some things to note... First, this hotel is located on the Vatican side of the Tiber. For most tourists (especially first-timers or families), besides the Vatican or Castel Sant' Angelo, none of the popular tourist attractions are in this area. Even the Vatican is a good 10-minute walk from the hotel (and I do mean normal walking pace, those reviewers who said it was a 5-minute "stroll" must stroll very fast). Case in point, my wife and I lived in the Campo de Fiori area literally a 5-10 minute walk to the Castel Sant' Angelo directly opposite it, on the opposite side of the river and closer to all the major sights, right in the historic center. Our home was a good 15-minute walk (if not more) to this hotel. Our home was a 10-15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and 15-20 to the Coliseum (I made this walk every day to my studio and it is not a comfortable walk as the straightest shot is Corso Vittorio Emmanuelle, a major thoroughfare and very busy). So add that 15 from our home to any of the other times. We are now talking 30-40 to the Coliseum. I honestly do not know how someone "strolls" there in 20 minutes. Second, along these lines, if you've been out all day sightseeing, walking here is the last thing you'll want to do. Luckily, Piazza Cavour is a major bus hub, but in actuality, if it's late in the evening or you just don't want to try to figure out the bus system (which can be confusing), you're going to end up taking a cab back here and that's going to cost you over 10 euros (and sometimes 20) from any of the major tourist sights. The point is, while the area is nice, it is NOT convenient for the average tourist, IMHO. Third, the block the hotel is on and those surrounding are DEAD AT NIGHT. They are safe, don't get me wrong, but if you're a worrier, single woman, or are letting your children on the loose by themselves while you rest, you might take that into account. One positive thing: there a few banks in the area meaning finding an ATM is not hard. FOOD: Others have noted the food options, but there are some places within a 5-7 minute walk where you can purchase pizza, sandwiches, wine, etc. This area also borders the Prati neightborhood, which is a main residential area of the city and has a wide variety of shops and food choices. If you're looking to see some of Rome away from the tourists, this is a good choice. The hotel does offer the usual breakfast of cold cuts, breads, cheeses, cereals and coffee. And it is solid, if unspectacular. But the fact that it's free is definitely a plus as this is by far the most convenient way to get some food in your stomach in this area early in the morning. FINAL THOUGHTS: Some on here have called this a 1-star hotel. In truth, most 3-star hotels and those in this price range in Rome will be along these lines. Do not expect much in the way of amenities, but do know that for their average rates (60-80 euros in high season, 45-65 in low is what I find skimming random dates right now), you will be getting a clean and comfortable hotel that will save you money if you are willing to do some walking. However, if you are elderly, are traveling with young kids, or otherwise have trouble getting around, this hotel is NOT for you. You would be much better served by spending more and staying in the Piazza Navona area, as it is equidistant from many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE, BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: cpds
Reviews.Content: This hotel canceled our room reservations, last minute ... simply because they could apparently get more $$ for our room. So don't plan on them honoring your reservation or on having a room ready on your Rome arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevef78
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better location. Only 10 minute stroll to the Vatican, 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain and Metro station and 20 minutes to the Colosseum. The rooms were spacious, bright and clean with everything you need for your stay. The breakfast was excellent, fresh with something for everyone. We took our parents for my Father's 70th birthday and my Mother was ill after a Chinese meal (we found out later this is common!). After 24 hours of sickness she felt better but wanted to stay in and rest. The maid had already told the manager she was ill and she came to the room asking if their was anything at all they could do, to just let them know. On the day she was resting they told us to go and enjoy our plans they would take care of her and took our mobile number. The staff called in to check on her every hour, brought her milk for tea and crackers. We came back to a well rested mother who knew all the staff by first names and how many children they had! This is far beyond what you'd expect from a hotel and we would like to thank all the staff for a perfect holiday. We would not hesitate to go back and stay there. We mainly ate at the 'La Francescana Ristorante' because it was near and the food was so good. The steaks are excellent and also the ravioli. The waiter Carlo took good care of us with our terrible Italian! We also had excellent pasta at 'Hosteria Dei Bastioni' restaurant just outside the Vatican. a good, family establishment with staff that make you feel like family they haven't seen for a while. Thank you Rome for the holiday of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Nikos949
Reviews.Content: From the first time you get in, theyare very helpfull in any question or problem you have.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay and amazingly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: coxy_gj
Reviews.Content: I was due to have a relatively complicated holiday in Rome. My girlfriend was to stay with me for four nights, a friend two and I would stay five. We started in a double room, my friend stayed in a single for one night, girlfriend left and he moved in. I asked if it could be switched to a twin and it was all taken their stride. Thestaff always managed to be professional but friendly and helpful. The real icing on the cake was my friend arrived late one night and I texted him where to meet us when he was on the plane. After not hearing back from him, I remembered he had a new phone and probably had not activated it for abroad. I called the hostel and managed to confuse the hotelier entirely, talking about rooms in different names, someone who may or may not have arrived. I gave directions to where I was and hung up knowing I was not going to see my friend that evening. I was totally wrong. The hotel had looked up the restaurant we were in and had it waiting for my friends arrival, they had drawn the route on the map and made post it notes with directions. They then found my number and called me to confirm the details. Great service! The hotel itself is in a lovely location. There is a brilliant coffee shop round the corner for breakfast on the river. Close to the Vatican, the main drinking and eating area down south and the centre. The hotel is lovely, we were in very small rooms but they were the budget options. The shower was tiny, I had to tell my girlfriend off for putting the shampoo on the ground as I could not bend over to get it! Not a real gripe as the place was clean, friendly and smart. If there was one complaint it was the first night. At night a phone rang non stop for ages somewhere in the building. At times there was also quit loud laughing and shouting from what I thought was staff. As I had had a long day travelling, a good nights sleep was required. The Italians speak loudly in general, so I realise it is a cultural thing! Unfortunately our room was close to reception. The hotel is really close to one of the two city airport bus stops. Which is handy! The other is by termini and the area is a dive. I would recommend and look to stay here again, if I ever return!

Reviews.Title: “excelllent!”
Reviews.Author: Cat_and_Liam
Reviews.Content: "Hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel was walking distance to every attraction and the location was perfect. It wasn't noisy or too busy and when we asked the staff for a kettle in our room, it wasn't standard but they got us one immediately anyway. They were helpful in telling us directions and ordering us a taxi and were always friendly and spoke good English. There were really nice and easily affordable restaurants around the corner (especially our favourite Vito's), awesome views and sights a short distance away. The room was a good size for the price, was well equipped with spare blankets and pillows (as it was cold when we went), the bathroom was small but adequate. The TV was a really good size and easy to use, as was all electrics in the hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Sweetnhi
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing Vatican and area. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is ok ,not gourmet but enough to keep you going. Rooms are basic no frills, fine for a short stay when you're out and about. Overall good value for money, good location ideal for weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Good position and value for money”
Reviews.Author: DragoV
Reviews.Content: When you are arriving to Sant Angelo hotel from Fiumicino airport best way is with shuttle bus. Station of shuttle bus is just out of Terminal 3 at Fiumicino airport. Company name is SIT shuttle bus and price per person (one way) is 8 Euro. It stops at Piazza Cavour – 5 min walking distance from hotel Sant Angelo. Time table of shuttle bus you can find online on their web page. It takes approximately 50 min from airport to Cavour bus stop. When we arrived at hotel we got very small room but luckily for us we were able to move to better room. We asked staff at reception and they have done this in quickest and best way that they could. Best thing with this hotel is its position (everything is within 10 to 15 min walking distance except Coliseum but with Metro from Spanish steps you are there for 5 min). Everything in this hotel is within value for money. If you are expecting Ritz Carlton services don’t stay here, but if you want relatively clean hotel (they can work little bit on this; but nothing to serious) with warm bedroom and close to tourist sights Sant Angelo is hotel for you. Wireless network is not reliable but on each floor you have computer that is free to use. One more good thing in hotel is buffet breakfast. It is served from 7:30 to 10:00. Tip for staff – half hour longer would be excellent. Hotel staff in general is polite and happy to help. We are pleased with our stay and we thank all staff for courtesy and help.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value for money”
Reviews.Author: Contes
Reviews.Content: No frills, very decent hotel, exceptionally well-located, operated by friendly and efficient staff. Made our stay in Rome all the more pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Maryna d
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and absolutely value for money. Friendly staff. Only negative experience we had was that the airconditioning didnt work properly in winter. Otherwise only compliments to the hotel and staff for our wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: malcolm b
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here from the 14th to the 18th of Nov. & we found it to be excellent for what we paid, at the end of the day we did not pay for the Ritz so do not expect Ritz standards. We checked in & found the guy on the desk to be really helpful but were a tad puzzled when the porter walked us over the road (we stayed on the 4th floor) to another building but when we saw the room this did not bother us. Cleaniness is a big thing for us & we both found the room spotless, also the bathroom did not disappoint as there was no mould in the shower cubicle which you tend to find in some budget hotels (we stayed in the Hotel Clarin in Rome two years ago & the Sant angelo was miles better). The room had a lovely Hi Def LCD Tv which had some great music channels on & the window looked out onto the main street. The street was noisy but you cannot blame the hotel for that. We did not have breakfast so can't comment on the dining, & for a location you could not ask for better. In a nutshell I would recommend the Hotel Sant Angelo to anyone on a budget & would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you really can´t afford any better, try other options”
Reviews.Author: Tahiri1321
Reviews.Content: Rating this hotel is really conflicting. I must say it has a rather good location, if not the best, within walking distance from major attractions and a few blocks away from some good restaurants. Also, some of the night staff were very nice. However, there were many things that outweighed the good points Among them: 1. We stayed at the annex. We didn´t mind walking a block from the main building. However, the annex was on a fourth floor, with the oldest and scariest lift I've ever taken (preferred to walk upstairs). This posed another issue: The building is old, dark and alone, and you can easily think of someone killing or mugging you on your way up, and you go in alone. 2. The beds were truly awuful. Linen was old and I couldn't decide if dark or dirty. The mattress was all bumpy and after the second day I had a very bad backache and had to flip the mattress around. 3. Although the room was clean, the hallway did have a peculiar not very nice smell. 4. TV had almost no channels in any other language but Italian. 5. The shower´s curtain was too lond and obstructed the drain, so if you did not keep moving it away every 30 seconds while bathing, the water could overflow. You couldn't arrange it to avoid it unless you didn't close the shower at all. All in all, it wouldn´t stay there again, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and well situated for Rome”
Reviews.Author: jcolesw2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights in September. I had stayed here previously, this together with the price and the location made the choice straight forward. I stayed in the Annex along the road from the main hotel building. The room was very clean, decent size with a reasonable bathroom. It had efficient air conditioning and for €95 per night for two was perfect. The hotel is well situated and an easy walk to many of the top sites in Rome. The surrounding area is quiet but safe and has some decent restaurants and bars (would recommend Vito's Restaurant especially). All in all, a good choice for Rome and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It is dusty and noisy,very hot ,no air condition ,not enough pillows and television is not working.funny hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zar76
Reviews.Content: It is a good location from the vatican but when we arrived the receptionist is not entertaining well even to tell us to sit down because we are exhausted from the journey and bringing our lugguage to the hotel room that there is no lift in going to reception but you step with a more flight of stairs to arrived in reception area.the room is not big enough,very hot no air condition but to open the large window were you can hear more noised outside shouting ,sirene of a car horn until late evening.no enough pillow and extra sheets.not working television.more dust in the bedside table,cabinet/cupboard where you hang your clothes and more dust in the extra bed like balcony type useless not useful no stair to step.old nice large antique canvass picture frame above the head board and lift is using engaged all time,very old and small, need new lift for the visitor guests and their lugguage to bring to the room not by stairs. Ok!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sant Angelo”
Reviews.Author: brian g
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week. It was in a very good location to get to all the major sites. The rooms were small but as we were not indoors much they were adequate. The hotel is exceedingly clean. We had clean bedding twice during the week and a stack of clean towels every day. The breakfasts were first class. It was serve yourself style with a selection of cerials, fruit, yoghurts, bread, butter & jam, boiled eggs, cheese & salami, omlette with bacon/sausage and cake with plenty of tea and coffee. We enjoyed the breakfasts very much. The ladies who organised the breakfasts were very pleasant and efficient. We would say that all the staff were most helpful - they would help with route finding and constantly asking if everything was o.k. There were two young men called Cipriano and Romeo who went out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. I certainly would use this hotel again and remommend it to anyone - for Rome we felt it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: mrtommy74
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff, good breakfast, fantastic coffee, small but adequate rooms. Roman streets do not have great signage, so the hotel can be hard to find for the average American who is accustomed to large and lighted street and business signs. Poorly lit but very safe area, and would stay there again. Its close to everything, but it doesnt reek of touristy. Rather, the area has a small neighborhood feel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for walking thru the city”
Reviews.Author: rodrigoac
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a central location to walk for both Rome and Vatican and this hotel met perfectly. I found this hotel in tripadvisor and chose it because of good reviews. Of course if you are looking for a wide room and careful service, your won't find it here, and you will need to pay a lot for that. The hotels in Rome are very expensive, this is a quite fair between price and quality for Italy. The building is old, elevator is really frightening, so choose the stairs. It was clean. I never saw staff people more than receptionist, so I don't know if staff was friendly or not. The room and bathroom were really really small, but you cannot be in the hotel during the day staying in Rome. From this hotel, we walked thru Vatican and complete historical Rome city in 3 days and we never took a cab. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: Kobus40
Reviews.Content: Spent six days there recently. Took two rooms. Small but convenient and relatively good value for money. The best thing about this hotel is its location. Very central within walking distance of most tourist attractions in the City centre,

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: aniraf11
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a triple room which was quite small without a mirror in the room which was inconvenient when trying to get ready to go out. the value for money was good compared to other hotels in the area. I would recommend for the location alone as it was walking distance to vatican, metro, piazza del popolo, we went everywhere by walk.the elevator was a bit small, I would not recommend it if you're going to spend time at the hotel but for everything else I wouls say go ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there, they are thieves and liars”
Reviews.Author: CinJen69
Reviews.Content: We recently staying @ the hotel for 6 days we had 3 rooms, 2 out of the 3 rooms didn't have a/c. From day 1 they promised they would have the a/c fixed... They never did. Not only had that happened but they over charged us 186 Euros that's $270 US. Which they haven't refunded back to us as they promised ... So, before you hand over your credit card make sure the room rate is correct... I have already disputed the amount and they have fudged their numbers... Make sure you have the invoice and you review it carefully. Don't let them tell you that they are unable too. They gave us a hand written (somewhat) invoice. I am still disputing the charges..

Reviews.Title: “Give them a chance”
Reviews.Author: Maeyer
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel recently taken over by new owners. They are extremely willing to please and make a success of their new investment. In the meantime they are upgrading each room floor by floor, getting new beds in, new air cons etc etc. The one staff member who was on duty when we arrived at 10pm was not keen on helping us get the luggage to the room or giving us valid information of how to get to the station to drop off our rented car. Besides that, after reporting him and some small electric issues we experienced we found the owners going out of their way to rectify this. The rooms are well sized and comfortable. They do offer a breakfast exlusive in ther room rate which we did not try. The hotel will improve as the new owners work their way into sorting out all their inherited problems. We would definetly return as it is so strategicaly located and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kurt K
Reviews.Content: Ok room,simple breakfast,friendly staff.Street was quiet,and some small cafe nearby.Close to river

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: vhill_10
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed here and seems to have been improved from last time with better breakfast and updated decor.location can't be beat, just across from the river, walking distance to the vatican and other major sites. Good aircon and wi-fi,which has complicated instructions. Excellent proximity for airport bus. Only downside is the staff, who have difficulty dealing with check-in, key returns, payment. Systems they use need updating so if checking out be prepared to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry if you get the Annexe”
Reviews.Author: Mikeleon
Reviews.Content: Some reviews were less than complimentary about the Annexe, we were on the 3rd floor and it has just been refurbished, it was clean, comfortable, with aircon and doubleglazing. Added bonus that there was a small Cafe opposite for breakfast croissants and coffee ( we were room only) also a Pizzeria opposite. It is close to all the main sites , we bought tickets on the plane for the 'Bus shuttle' the Vatican stop is only 200mtrs from Hotel so a very good option.We loved our stay there

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant soprise”
Reviews.Author: Bojanajo
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in hotel Sant angelo for 5 days of our beautiful trip to Rome. Regarding the prices in centrally located roman hotels, we did not expect much, but vere pleasantly soprised. Everything in this hotel was almost perfect - small but clean and charming room, very clean bathroom, very good brakfast with variety of all kinds of very tasty food, service and above all - excellent location. Also, very important is a fact that the airport Fuimicino is easily reachable by shuttle bus and bus stop is located only about 100m from the hotel. We will definatelly go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location, I'll go back!”
Reviews.Author: mag-90
Reviews.Content: We had a triple bed room, quite small but pleasant and very quiet. The air conditioning worked well. The breakfast was nice (fruits, breads, chocolate and vanilla breads, cereals...). The staff was very friendly, they speak english but also french. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: natauc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel Sant Angelo and were greated by a young friendly italian who spoke english very well. We were told we had to walk over 50 meters to another building where our room was. It was a little inconvenient with all our bags but off we went. The room was big enough and our bathroom was a good size (Europe standards). I was told I could get wireless but had a hard time finding it. After calling the front desk, the young man told me he'd come over to help me out, which he did and very much appreciated. The staff was very kind, all three that we dealt with. We found it a little expensive compared to the other hotels where we stayed, with things seem to be much more expensive in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good enough”
Reviews.Author: BorisBex
Reviews.Content: We booked up the 'annex' room with booking.com. I was nervous, as it was slightly cheaper than another listing claiming rooms of the same size. I needn't have worried too much - the room was basic but the reason it was cheaper was it was in another building on the same road. I get the feeling it was a residential building but we saw & heard few people. (if you paid for breakfast inclusive, you'd have to walk down the road for it). The room had a double bed (requested, as often you get twin beds in a continental room), wardrobe, dressing table with the tv on it and a couple of chairs (not comfy ones). We asked for extra pillows (expected there to be extra in the wardrobe but there wasnt) and never got them. Other than that minor problem, we had a stress free stay in Rome. ooh word of advice...... dont book a taxi (to the airport for example) from the receptionist as they cant guarantee the price and you might end up paying a call out fee. Instead walk from the hotel towards the Vatican and there is a taxi rank in the first square (piazza cavour) - it's mins down the road. Overall, not a posh hotel but it did the trick and we slept well here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bvlahos
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel nearly 4 months ago, my choice being based upon the amenities I read over the internet (just as usually happens with all of us travelers). When I arrived there, they told me that I would stay in another hotel, Hotel Angel, 100 meters away from Hotel Sant' Angelo. The Angel Hotel DID NOT have a 24 hour front desk, did not have a sat TV and the rooms were not as those we had seen during the process of choosing Hotel. The receptionist was not helpful at all, did not speak English adequately and sometimes we had the feeling that she was calling us names in her language. Although we had an emailed confirmation that clearly stated that breakfast was inclusive, they refused to provide breakfast to us and they demanded an extra amount of 7.50 euros per person/per night. The rooms were clean but too small (approximately 3.5m x 3.5m - at least the 103 room in Angel Hotel we used). The hotel manager failed to meet his obligations towards us, as he never accepted to include breakfast in the price paid. The only good fact about the hotel is its location, extremely close to Piazza Cavour and a 10 minutes walk from famous Rome attractions. Although its location, I would never ever again book a room in this Hotel! They are no professionals, they only want your money, they don''t care if you enjoy the stay in Rome! Never again in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and amazing city!!”
Reviews.Author: Co-operativeTravel
Reviews.Content: I am a Branch Manager at The Co-operative Travel and have travelled alot but never done many cities.. Rome was my favorite by a mile.. The hotel is on a side road by the river and 5-10 mins walk from everywhere, very clean and very friendly staff, on arrival it has a large grand entrance way which leads to a very small lift to the first floor where the hotel reception is.. it is a small hotel, very cozy but our room for me, mum and my sister was lovely! cleaned everyday, flat screen tv ( all in italian but who needs a tv in rome!) little fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, as other reviews the bathroom is small but all tiled and very clean, toilet, biddet, sink and shower with large mirror and bright lights.. the breakfast of a morning was lovely, continental with pastries, hot boiled eggs, crossaints, cereal and yoghurt... Rome is amazing.. if ya travel and are there on a wednesday the pope does a service inside the vatcian which we were lucky enough to get in to it was an amazing experience!! be warned you need to be there early!! we travelled for my mums 60th birthday and had an amazing time some lovely restaraunts especially by the pantheon in the side streets...... food and tiramasu was fab!!! i recommend this to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kaidiudris
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sant Angelo for 1 week, spontanuously booking a room after escaping Cairo demonstrations in Egypt. Im usually a more budget kind of traveller and thought I would treat myself with something nice and more costly in the heart of Cairo. I was somewhat dissapointed. The hotel comprises two separate builidings in the same street so if You want to leave Your key to reception or use the public computer for internet, You have to get dressed and leave Your builing for the main hotel building. The room was a standard one, but in reality wasn't as fancy as the fotos show on the site or on tripadvisor. As I left from Cairo I wanted to be update with the news, but the room TV was broken - picture came and went as pleased. I asked them to have the technician look at it, twice, nothing improved within 4 days... They provide you with shampoo and shower gel, no conditioner for some reason... And no tea/coffe equipment in standard room, as is the regular custom elswhere in Europe! The staff was helpful enough. The most hospitable and kind was Mikolai! He really knows the ins ans outs of this city and knows what to reccommend when You tell what You are expecting and looking for. Overall the stay wasn't worth the price, but most probably its just the sacrifice one must make to stay in Rome overall.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK - bathroom not”
Reviews.Author: rookeynook
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was the best thing about it. The bedroom was OK but noise from busy street and bin men came every night crashing up and down the street so sleep was difficult. Everything in the bathroom was useless. Toilet seat, toilet brush and pedal bin - broken. Washbasin - wouldn't retain water. Shower tray - leaked (even when it hadn't been used.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy-cozy Roman charm”
Reviews.Author: JeffRamsell
Reviews.Content: From first to last the staff were very efficient and helpful. Despite the reception being on the first floor which is a little strange at first, the whole ambience of the hotel is excellant. The lift is small (which goes with the building being very old), but 2 journeys got the luggage for all 5 of us upstairs easily. The rooms, though a little on the small side, were well equipped for our purposes. The breakfast room, on the first floor, is light and airy and the buffet breakfast was the perfect "set up" for the day's sightseeing. The location was perfect for us, Piazza Cavour is 150m walk to get a bus. Spanish Steps a 15 minute walk, Piazza Navona 10 minutes. There are numerous restaurants nearby with menus to suit all budgets, we paticularly enjoyed Ristorante Pallazaccio on Via Ennio Quirino Visconti (5 mins walk). Just ask the reception staff they will be happy to help. Liked best: Helpful staff & location. Liked least lack of a bar or lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sundboell
Reviews.Content: Pro's - decent location - nice staff - real Italian rooms (small, cute) Cons - a bit away from the action - only a con, if you like to be in the middle of it all ! Favorite suggestion; - rent a scooter - nothing makes you feel more Italian, than driving around in traffic. You can reach all the essential sights in less than 20 mins - and it's much funnier than taxi. The hotel can give you name of a rental company - try the restaurant at the top of Hotel Forum, for something a bit out of the ordinary. It's posh and expensive, but with a great view. For a more Italian experience, just go for spaghetti at Piazza Navona (which we liked better than Travestere, as a neighbourhood)

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleased with my experience at Hotel Sant Angelo”
Reviews.Author: JoefromSydney
Reviews.Content: Close to everything. VERY friendly and helpful staff. I totally enjoyed it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location very helpful staff excellent value”
Reviews.Author: bigbrindle
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel august 10th 2010 it is very close to all the famous must see attractions, it is clean with excellent helpful staff, breakfast very good, italian breakfasts can be plain, but this was as good as any. The shuttle transfers organised by hotel very effiicient and quite reasonable it worked out at 12 euros per person . rooms are nice size and a/c good and necessary in august would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sant Angelo - great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: caz_rAustralia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Hotel Sant Angelo with my friend for two nights. We had looked up a lot of hotels before choosing this one based on location and price. Airport to Hotel: easiest way is to take the 'Express Bus' (8 euro per person) which goes direct from the International Airport to Piazza Cavour and Termini Station. Get off at Piazza Cavour, look for the white church, and the hotel is about 100m up the road. Other people took the Leonardo Express train from the Airport to Termini Station, then you would have to take a bus or taxi from there. Location was excellent, in walking distance from all the major sites (Vatican about 15 minutes, Spanish Steps 15 minutes, Trevi Fountain 20 minutes, Collosseum 40 minutes). It was nice being in a slightly less touristy area but being able to walk everywhere. Breakfast was included in our rates and was served from 7am til 10am everyday. Not what we are used to in Australia, but did include two types of cereal, yoghurts, pastries and meats\cheeses. Could also get a cappucino made for you. Room: I had read on other reviews that the rooms were really small, so was pleasantly surprised by ours, which was small but comfortable. We had twin beds with ample room for luggage etc. If you are going to Rome to rest in a hotel, this is not the place for you. But for us it was comfortable and clean. The bathroom is TINY, however! Especially the shower. You couldn´t stretch yours arms out at all! Overall, the Hotel Sant Angelo was perfect for our stay in Rome, in terms of location, price, cleanliness and providing breakfast. I think similar minded travellers would also enjoy it. Its not the hotel for you if you are after a luxurious rest, but otherwise was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mick0853
Reviews.Content: we have recently returned from a four day stay in rome at this hotel. First thing we want to say is the pictures we feel were misleading. when were the the pictures actually taken?. rooms were very basic....no coffee making facilities, showers very small, our television didnt work. Even tho you dont come on holiday to watch telly its a welcome item after walking around rome when you want to relax. breakfast was also basic. somedays were better than others. one days bread and butter had actually run out!! . On a plus side the location was good. easy to get around the city. I dont normally right reviews but we felt we needed to sound our opinion on this occasion as we were disappointed and felt the hotel really wasnt good value for money. wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Paschalis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, althought the first impression was not very good. You have to take a small elevator and get to the first floor, where you can find the reception, which is not very nice also. Then you get again the elevator to move to the floor of your room (one day the elevator was broken and we had to go up and down to the 3rd floor using the stairs). The room was OK, maybe a bit small, but clean. It could be done some renovation, but this was not a real problem. The breakfast was good, and the reception personel was very helpfull, giving us all the information we asked for. they even search the internet in order to find what we were looking for. The location of the hotel was really great, 5-10 min walking from most of the major attractions (piazza di spagna, fontana di trevi etc.). in addition, from piazza cavour, which is only 100 meters away, you can get a but to almost anywhere you wand to go. You can also find plenty of taxis there. So overall, it is a nice, but not luxury hotel, in a great location to walk to any attraction in Romes historic center.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel near main sights in historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: RochesterLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel sant angelo from June 09 to June 18, 2009. We had previously stayed at this Hotel for a week in past years. We like this Hotel because it it so near the historic sites of Rome. The breakfasts are quite simple with the usual cereals, rolls of ham and cheese etc. The rooms are beautifully cleaned each morning with clean linen. We like the quiet street where the hotel is situated. We are going back to the hotel sant angelo for one week from June 09, 2010, and we are looking forward to our trip, and indeed, our stay at this hotel. We have read other reviews with complaints regarding noise from other rooms, but we have never suffered any noise when we visited this Hotel.. there have also been complaints regarding the elevator which has been described as a wardrobe. Dear friends, forget all of these negative comments, jusr go to the hotel sant angelo and with its proximity to the centre of Rome and its historic sites you will truly feel so satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay much, don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: carlosinmiami
Reviews.Content: Only good thing about this hotel is the location. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. That's about it. Very depressing rooms. Shower is like a cruise ship shower, you barely fit, it had an accordian wrap around that leaked, so our floor was a mess. We had to use up all of the towels every time we showrd to try to keep the floor dry. Very budget, tourist class hotel, the only reason that I stayed was because we had pre-paid from the states and I was not about to argue & ruin my vacation, but it will never happen to em again, next time I'd rather lose the money. Car service (54 EUR) very dependable.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: ohiobillLima_Ohio
Reviews.Content: The Sant Angelo Hotel is located on the Vatican side of the Tiber, about 2 blocks east of Piazza Cavour. The neighborhood is safe and a mixture of upscale apartments and small hotels and restaurants. You can walk to the Vatican in about 15 minutes or a local bus is just around the corner. Sites such as the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, and the Pantheon are about a 25 minute walk in the other direction. Again, public transportation is inexpensive and readily available. An express commuter train, the Leonardo Express, costing E11 takes you directly from Fiumicino Airport to Termini , the main train station, in about 30 minutes. It is approximately a E15 taxi ride to the hotel from Termini. Those who are willing to utilize public transportation from the airport (Fiumicino) can take the local train, which costs E5.5 from the airport, getting off at Ostiense, it does not stop at Termini, and then taking city bus 280, for E1 to Piazza Cavor. The best option might be an express bus from the Fiumicino airport (E8) which will take you to Piazza Cavour. Look for the location of the express bus stop at baggage claim at the airport. From Piazza Cavour look for a large white church located at the northeast corner. The hotel is on Via M. Dionigi, which begins at the side of the church. However you choose to get there you will find the Sant Angelo to be an excellent place for your Roman adventure. Via M. Dionigi is a relatively quiet side street. The entrance to the hote is unassuming. You enter the building on the ground floor.The lobby is on the first floor which can be reached by a small elevator. Upon arrival you will be greeted by friendly, English speaking staff. During our stay we especially found Claudio, Valerio and Antonio to be most helpful. Jackelyn, who took care of us at breakfast, was a delight. The rooms themselves are a good size for Italy. Americans traveling to Italy for the first time, will find most rooms smaller than what we have at home. Unlike some hotels we have stayed at in Italy, we did not feel cramped. There is sufficient space for clothing in a double dresser and wardrobe. Our room, on the 3rd floor, had a charming and functional floor to ceiling door instead of a window. Street noise was not a problem. The walls appeared to have been freshly painted and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was nicely tiled. Unlike many Italian hotels, there were doors on the shower, rather than simply an open space in the corner of the bathroom. Although the shower space was sufficient for us, a very large person (300lbs+) might feel a bit confined in the shower. Most signifiantly the room, including the bathroom was spotless and well maintained by the housekeeping staff during our 3 night stay. Breakfast is served buffet style in a small dining area adjacent to the lobby. There is an excellent selection of breads, pastrys, meats, cheeses, cereals and juices available. The previously mentioned Jacquelyn will ensure your cappucino, espresso, cafe americano or tea is freshly prepared. This is the 3rd different hotel we have stayed at in Rome and is clearly our favorite. We paid E69 nightly, breakfast included, and found it to be quite a bargain. The staff is excellent, the rooms are clean and comfortable, the location is convenient and safe, the breakfast is quite tasty and the price is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills but good”
Reviews.Author: A1tkendrum
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given a first floor room that was so small there was barely room to walk around the bed. We arrived late and slept the night there on a very basic and uncomfortable bed. Next day we asked for an upgrade to a superior room and the staff were very helpful and we moved with minimum fuss. We stayed 5 nights in all and were only charged 50 euros for the upgrade but it was well worth it. Good tip to buy a 3 day ticket travel ticket from one of the open top bus companies near the Vatican. 25 Euros each for 3 days unlimited travel on tube, tram, or bus including the city buses was good. There is a lot of walking involved otherwise and the cobbled streets and high kerbs take their toll on feet and back. Sturdy shoes are a must.

Reviews.Title: “Not particularly expensive, but not particularly great either”
Reviews.Author: jpark10
Reviews.Content: I had a night to stay in Rome, and it was a short stay, so we just decided to get a cheaper place. The building you can tell is an older one, but they've managed to keep it clean at least. The workers in the daytime were super friendly and nice. The nighttime guy seemed nice at first but then he was very rude the next morning when booking a hotel for us. You had to pay a lot for super slow internet in the lobby. Breakfast wasn't bad. Not the coolest location but near the river and Vatican City. Again, if I needed to stay in Rome a long time I wouldn't book this place, but it isn't that bad for a short stay if you are looking for something cheap and reasonably clean (small rooms though).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, Better Location!”
Reviews.Author: constantine84
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival my girlfriend and I were greated by the friendliest of hotel staff, who kept us entertained as we awaited our room to be ready since we arrived earlier than the permitted check in time. Once our room was ready we made our way up via the the "lift". The room was quite small for what we expected however did have the basic essentials, so it was not a bother as it was just a place lay our heads. Location wise the hotel was jus perfect. Only 10 minute walk from anything and everything worth seing (minus the collusseum which was only a 10 minute "free" bus ride away). Breakfast was well rounded, cereal, fruits, yoghurts, croissants, doughnuts, tea and coffee etc. Good fuel to prepare ourselves for a day of sight seing. Definately worth setting your alarm for. Only negative worth mentioning was our disfunctioning toilet which would not flush properly. Upon raising the issue with a staff member we were concerned at the lack of urgency and hygenic awareness when he said he will send a technician the following day, who never came. However this was rectified with a combination of my engineering skills and ingenuity, the toilet became safe to use. Overall we did enjoy our stay at Sant Angelo with the welcoming and helpful staff ensuring our time in Rome was a pleasureable one. Would reccomend it to those seeking a weekend break in the city. Pretty much anything you need is just a stone throw away, restuaraunts, cinema, pharmacies, shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel friendly staff good location”
Reviews.Author: rambler021
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay. Hotel on first floor. Walk up 2 flights of stairs or get a lift which looks like a converted wardrobe. Reception clean and bright. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room basic but clean. Bathroom small (small shower - no Bath). Air conditiioning on 24/7. An exceptionally pleasant place to stay with a fantastic location close to the main tourist attractions

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: jayshah51
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and definately not 3 stars. ( later on in our visits to other cities in Italy that Italian star system seems to be lower standereds than other europian standeredrs). The reception is seperate and the enterenace to the building for the rooms is from an ally. The elevetor is very small and with Lugage only one person can go. Rooms are small but comfirtable. The walls of the room are thin so lot of noice from the streets but also can hear guests from other rooms. However the staff were nice and help full. The location is perfect. Infact we walked to all the places except the station where you have to take a cab. The breakfast was being served in another hotel across the street but it was good. One has to go there early as every one is in a hurry to go for sight seeing so it gets crowded very fast.

Reviews.Title: “* * * Hotel Sant Angelo - Excellent location * * *”
Reviews.Author: m-a-r-u-s-k-a-8-9
Reviews.Content: We selected hotel Hotel Sant' Angelo for it´s great location and low rates. When visiting this hotel I definitely reccomend taxi transport (Mercedes cars) from/to the airport organized by the hotel for 50€ - one way/max. 4 people. We had a triple room and a double room. Rooms: - clean / room service everyday - refrigerator - (triple room) - view - nothing special - thin walls - you can hear everything your neighbour does :-( - pretty annoying - bathroom - really small - 3/5 for cleanness - beds - uncomfortable Breakfast: - poor - dirty chairs at the table - bread - not fresh everyday :-( Location: - great - we pretty much walked to all the historical sites - shooping - fantastic Reccomend: - Giolitti (www.giolitti.it) It has the best ice-cream I ever had in my life! - It´s near Palazzo Montecitorio / street - Via degli Uff. d. Vicario

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: johnboy1951
Reviews.Content: As in other reviews, the main draw to this hotel is its location and very friendly and helpful staff. Our daughter and her husband treated my wife and I to a whirl-wind tour of Europe and this was one of our stops from 12/21/08-12/25/08. The breakfasts were great along with a couple of cups of cappuccino and you could spend the entire day sight-seeing and not care about another meal until supper time. Easy walking distance to the Vatican museum, St.Peter's square, Trvevi fountain, Pantheon and Spanish steps. A little further walk but manageable to the Forum and Colosseum. A taxi stand area is just up the block away from the river for an exhilarating ride back to Roma Termini (Rome Terminal station) fairly inexpensive if during the day. The rooms are small but comfortable, bathrooms are also small as well as the elevator but you're there to tour not stay in the rooms, right. Price is reasonable for its location, I will stay here again on my future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean location close to the Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller81
Reviews.Content: Good Points * Clean, decent size room * Great proximity to Vatican City * Fantastic breakfast * Lovely area of Rome * Very friendly, helpful staff * Safe available in reception Bad Points * Thin walls, very noisy * Lots of street noise from works across the road, some double glazing wouldn't go astray.

Reviews.Title: “friendlystaff”
Reviews.Author: bluetail47
Reviews.Content: The hotel was difficult to find as it is in the middle of a side street an not well marked from the outside. There are street signs, however, that help you get close. The lobby of hotel is upstairs. Elevator is extremely small - two people with luggage was tight. The rooms are clean and decent size for Europe. Bed was comfortable and continental breakfast was good. Location was okay, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “History everywhere”
Reviews.Author: SpuriousMode
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an excellent location. The Vatican is a short walk one way, and the centre or Rome is a short walk the other way. The hotel itself is adeuqate but nothing special. Bed ok, bathroom very small. If you are an overweight American (or any other nationality) then avoid this hotel. Otherwise the location makes it a very good choice. The breakfast is passable, but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend, big disappontment”
Reviews.Author: pdtrip
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing hotel... I agree with previous reviews that the location is superb but there are much better hotels in the same area. We stayed 5 nights and our room was tiny. The bathroom was so small I would doubt that a person with a slightly larger than normal size, could get into the shower. Big problems to be aware of. 1. There is a huge amount of constuction work going on at the hotel, cleaning roof and walls. Each morning at around 7am we woke to drills and the feeling someone was knocking down our hotel room. We asked the reception about it and they told us there was no work Fri or Sat. We were never told about this work before arriving. 2. Breakfast room is not big enough for all the guests. Each morning you have to wait. On our first morning we waited for 20 mins for a table to be cleared, despite it being empty. When we sat down the waitress starrted clearing aways breakfast food after 8 mins. She said hotels rules were breakfast ends at 10am. If just a shame she was not as efficient at clearing the empty tables and we might have enjoyed a 30 mins breakfast. 3. There is no internet connection, the small computer in the corner was broken. so dont bank on staying connected as the hotel advertises. 4. We had a 5 night stay in a very hot Rome. I had to ask that our sheets were changed on day 4, If I had not asked, I am sure they would not have been changed. 5. Staff were functionally friendly but not helpful. They did the very mimimum and really didnt care more like they were doing you a favour by letting you stay there. A very poor hotel and very low standards maybe due to new owners. I will never stay there again and believe Rome has much more to offer than what this place gives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and more!”
Reviews.Author: DublinNwatson
Reviews.Content: Just spent five nights in Rome at hotel Sant Angelo. Location was just amazing....walked everywhere and never had to use public transport except on last day when we took the number 110 bus (open-topped sight-seeing bus) to give our legs a rest! Hotel was lovely. I was apprehensive, especially after reading some of the negative comments on the website but, thankfully, there was no need to worry. The room was meticulously cleaned every day with fresh towels suppplied daily also. We were never disturbed by noise from other rooms. Air conditioning worked a treat and BBC 3 news on TV kept us abreast of what was going on in the world. Bathroom was small and so was shower but the excellent pressure of the shower was greatly appreciated by myself, especially when washing my hair! Bed was firm (our preference anyway) and pillows were on the flat side (again as we would prefer). Breakfast is small and limited but still very adequate.....it's a non event in Rome generally. Vitos around the corner is a fabulous restaurant where you can get great food at reasonable prices. Moreover, the staff are so helpful and friendly, all speaking excellent English. If you are wavering about whether to stay here or not, go ahead and book! You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JSatelmajer
Reviews.Content: Nice quite location. It is about a 20 minute walk to Forum and sites but subway is only 10 minute walk. We found the hotel to be quite itself, breakfast was excellent, with many options in a large sunny room. Not sure where some people who reviewed stayed but there are two nice large reception sitting areas. Each room is unique, ours had a shower with bath that included both shower and bath jets. Room was nicely decorated with small balcony looking over gardens and orange trees. Very clean. Staff were very friendly and helped us with all of our questions. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: hbucket1
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a very old building. I would choose this hotel for location alone. Any of the major sites are easily within 20 minutes walking distance from this hotel, therefore no worries about public transport while staying there. rooms small but quite adequate, spotless clean. The staff at reception are most helpful. The breakfast although continental was very good. the breakfast room was quite small and only seated about 22 people at a time. The hotel can arrange a taxi service to the airport and this is cheaper than getting a taxi to and from the airport. We had no problem with noise in the hotel either from adjoining rooms or traffic, however we were at the back of the hotel so not near the road. Our stay in this hotel was very pleasant at a very reasonable rate for rome

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TM01
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were small, the location was excellent! a short stroll to the main streets, shops and sights. I stayed here 3 times purely because i knew i was going to get good value for money, and it was convenient. You could easily walk everywhere from this hotel. The rooms were very clean also.

Reviews.Title: “Small noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandTom
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. Hotel disappointing. Bedroom extremely small but clean. Very noisy from outside and from adjoining bedroom. Could hear people talking in next door bedroom. Bathroom (no bath, shower only) extremely small. Shower door fell off twice and toilet did not always flush properly. Poor selection for breakfast. Website photos very deceiving. No sign of large reception room and bedrooms as shown on website and hotel cards currently in use. Changed ownership in May 07. Would not recommend this hotel and would not stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: vmr1270
Reviews.Content: Would I stay here again? Yes, but for much less. For less than $200. $150 seems reasonalbe for Rome, but we ended up paying 2x that. I'm talking dollars here, not euros. The Good stuff was: 1. The service was good. I always felt I could approach them for about anything if I wanted. Our first morning there we kept blowing out hte power in our room, because brought a high-voltage blow dryer and kept trying to use it. They were very nice aobut it every singel time. 2. The location was great walked pretty much everywhere. Went to the front desk most morning to ask if we needed a bus and they would help us out by telling us yes or no. Then would look up what bus would get us there and back from the bus stop a block away. 3. You need airconditioning in the summer in Rome. Especially when you've walked for most of the day in the heat of the day. 4. Clean, never saw any bugs. Never felt grossed out. 5. Really liked that instead of a window, we had doors that opend up. No balcony, but had metal bars to lean on to see the neighborhood outside. 6. After being warned about how tiny the rooms and bathrooms are in Europe. I considered our room to be pretty roomy as was the bathroom. 7. Really liked that could get a private car to and from hotel. And it was especially nice since it was a Mercedez. Each way was 49 Euros. All I had to do was let the hotel know that I needed a transfer and they arranged everything. The Not so good: 1. The price. I knew before hand that I was going to pay 200 euros for a triple room a night. Just didin't know that the exchange rate was $100=70 Euros. So it ended up being $285 a night. 2. The tiny shower stall. Let's put it this way. Stand and put your hands on your head and elbows stick out. Your elbows will be touching the walls and shower door. And I'm not a tall or big person. Forget bending down to wash your feet. Had to twist and lift to do that one. 3. The non working T.V., but it worked to my advantage. I could barley get my companions out the door, so with a T.V. we never would have seen the city. 4. Now the power does work, just don't take anything that uses to much power. The curling iron did work on a low setting. We were able to charge our phones, cameras, and MP3 players but does take longer. 5. The lift was TINY. With just three people we were packed in. With luggage we had to seperate, because couldn't fit. Most of the time we just used the stairs, it was faster that way. 6. The breakfast wouldn't have paid extra for it, so the good thing was it was included. Your choices are: Breads, cereal, yogurt, a cake, hard dry bread, three choices of thinnly sliced meat and cheeses, fruit from cocktail can, pineapple and orange juice, water, and milk. They have waitress that serve hot chocolate, cappucino, coffee, espresso. 7. Beds are hard and the pillows are a joke. BUt as I understand that is pretty much any hotel in Rome. When you are very tired from sightseeing, though any bed will do. Really liked that the people at the front desk spoke several lanugages. So no problem communicaitng. Just so you know when you arrive you have to take the lift to the first floor where the front desk is located or just take the stairs one flight up. Again yes would stay here again, because it is a good location, clean, and good service. But just not so expenisve.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but.....”
Reviews.Author: KeentravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2005 and loved it. We therefore didn't hesitate booking it again for a repeat visit to Rome. What a disappointment. We were given a miniscule double room and when we asked if there were a slightly larger room available we were brushed off with a prompt no despite the fact that we pointed out we had booked over three months earlier. The airconditioning system was broken so we couldn't adjust our unit - we could either have it very cold constantly or open the windows to a noisy street which made sleeping really difficult. The bathroom had a constant smell of sewage. The breakfast is probably the skimpiest selection I've ever come across but the cappucinos/lattes are fantastic. On our last day we received a phone call from reception at 11:15 a.m. instructing us in a most rude manner to vacate the room NOW even though it on our reservation confirmation said check-out time was noon. We asked if we could have a shower somewhere prior to departure later that day but this was not possible. We were told we could use the staff toilet - it was disgusting! I'll never stay here again and I'll never recommend this place to freinds and family as I have done in the past. The treatment we received for paying £110/night was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: jojomartin
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a long weekend with my mother after reading the reviews here and looking at the website. We were also attracted by the fact that the hotel offers a transfer from the airport to the hotel, which we booked. Unfortunately however, the driver didn't show up at the airport. After several calls to the hotel and an hour wait (in which they told us to wait...) we got a normal cab for 55 euros, which was quicker than the public transport. The hotel is in the Prati district on the Vatican side of the Tiber in a beautiful well-kept 19 th century mansion block. We had our rooms in the belle etage, facing the street. The hotel has obviously been converted from former bourgeois apartments. The ceiling of the room had been lowered from about 4 metres to 3 metres. Coving elements have been replaced. The fittings were in style with the house, and the bathroom was small but modern. There was no minibar and the TV could hardly receive one Italian channel (but we weren't there for telly!) The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful indeed. A great plus point of the Sant'Angelo is its location. You can reach all the major sights of the city by foot within 20 minutes. For the antique sights (Colloseum, Palatine, Forum etc.) take the 87 bus from the next street for the bargain price of one euro a ride. The location is therefore great! One drawback was the paperthin walls - we could hear my mother coughing two rooms away and the maids doing the rooms next-door. The breakfast was basic but substantial, and again, the staff were friendly. In sum, the Sant'Angelo is a good place for sleeping in Rome. It is not a hotel where one would stay during the day. We paid 185 euros per night. In Vienna, Budapest and Paris we paid less for 4 star hotels. So we had doubts whether the Sant'Angelo really offered value for money. But maybe that's just Rome? And, by the way, the transfer back to the airport worked!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobboEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, arrived late in the evening and the staff were very helpful and understanding. The Breakfast was well stocked. The Room was spacious and soundproof, so you didnt hear any of your neighbours. Ideal location if you are wanting to visit the Vatican City, and easy to find, only 10 mins in a taxi to termini. The lift was a bit small, found it easier to use the stairs, which were elegant marble. Would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: curiouskitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room is small, but we can manage it. The hotel is in a greate location, many attractions within walking distance: 15 mins to Piazza St Peter, 20 mins to Vatican Museum, 15 mins to Spanish Steps, 10 mins to Panthon, 7 mins to Piazza Navona(we are young couple, at late 20's). And very good customer service as well, very friendly, always provide correct information to guests. The city map was given by the hotel is much detailed than the the one we bought in Scotland very useful for 1st time traveller. Cons: 1. The sound-prove of each room is really bad, I always waked by neighbor sneezing, flushing toilet etc in the night . So if you are a light sleeping person as me, you should think about this, you do need to restore your energy for the next day when you want to visit many places. 2. It can be very dusty in Rome, the maid service is not very good at all. They don't mop the floor as long as you stay there, at the final day, we have to wear trainers in the hotel room, that also explained why my neighbour always sneeze. And they didn't replace shower gel for us, even we have nothing to use, in the third day we have to use soap. Well, I don't think this hotel is too bad, for it's location and customer service, you still can consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Our Engagment”
Reviews.Author: Jason35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sant Angelo last March, found it good value for money, great location and the service exceptional! I'd contacted the hotel prior to travelling as I was going to propose to my girlfriend whilst in Rome, the staff couldn't been more helpful. They arranged, and secretly stowed away glasses, a bottle of Champagne and a car to take us to Giancolo Hill so I could suprise my girlfiend. Not only that, they looked after the ring, and managed to keep it all a secret! They also recommended fab restaurants and arranged taxi's and airport transfers when ever we needed. Could not of done more for us. We're going back this year as part of our honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: mariebrussel
Reviews.Content: We booked at hotel angel but were put in the sant angelo. I think we had the same room (203). Our loo did not work either so after 1 night and coming back at lunchtime our 2nd day to see if anything had changed (nothing had!) we were put in another room. This room was on the streetside so more noise and we had much more noise from the other rooms too. There were still hairs in the shower and bugs crawling behind the wooden panneling when we switched on the light. We found the breakfast OK (juice terrible!!!!!!!!!!) and were not charged for breakfast. We were lucky we only paid 85 euros for our room (therefore the okay rating), so some may say you get what you pay for but I would have been shocked if this stay would have cost me 150 a night (or even more). But we had a nice time in Rome, loved walking around in trastevere and visiting all the sights!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: babybuny
Reviews.Content: Seriously awful hotel. We booked 2 doubles. Each was the size of a postage stamp. The bathroom was no bigger than that on an airline. Could hear every little noise from our bathroom and my children's next door. The loo did not flush. The room was so depressing. The bathroom some sort of sick joke. Breakfast was horriffic, paper cups for revolting juice.I have never really given anyone a bad review but this hotel was horrific. Location was it's only redeeming feature. Would rather not return to Rome if I had to stay here. Felt like a broke student in this very basic, dated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel for the Siteseer”
Reviews.Author: PeterandJean
Reviews.Content: My wife and i found this Hotel to be Excellent in every way. The Staff were Friendly & willing to help at all times. The rooms were large and clean and everything worked!. We really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay - first time travellers to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kayjo72
Reviews.Content: After having read many reviews warning travellers about various Roman rip-offs and poor hotel reviews, we had adjusted our expectations accordingly. We arranged through the hotel to have a car pick us up from Fiumicino airport, and we were grateful to find that our driver was there at the arrivals gate, waiting for us with a sign (and a brand new Mercedes!), even after our baggage was delayed getting off the plane. The car service arranged by the hotel was 49 Euros (from what we understand, is about average) and was added to our hotel bill, which made our introduction to the eternal city that much easier. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, and speak excellent English. Our room (a double) was cozy , clean, and quite adequate for our needs. Some reviewers have mentioned the shower: when you get up from your computer, imagine that you are sitting astride a Vespa scooter (which are everywhere in Rome!) -- and the position of your feet will give you an idea of the amount of space in the shower from corner to corner. However, my 6' 3", 250 lb boyfriend had no trouble using the shower, and I think the North American expectations of available space are a little unrealistic when you remember that this hotel is in a very old building. The continental breakfast was, again, better than what we had expected. The hotel's location can't be beat - it's on a quiet street, and only a 15 minute walk to Piazza Navona and the Vatican. Our room was on an inner courtyard so there were no problems with garbage collectors banging about in the middle of the night. The only small issues that we found were with the pillows (very thin), bath towels (of a very generous size, but also very thin, like a dish towel), and there was no English tv available - but then, we weren't there to watch tv. We highly recommend this hotel, and we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewToChicago
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at this hotel. The location is excellent for many tourist sites and good eating choices. Our room was very nice. It is on a side street and not a lot of noise or congestion. We loved a restaurant Francescana, about 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jan 06. Very good value hotel. I'd reccommend it to couples or anyone who'd like to stay within walking distance of the Vatican and the city centre. Not an especially touristy area, though nice all the same. Nice cafe's around - one top notch little chocolatier/coffee shop nearby. Nice clean rooms, showers are tiny though.

Reviews.Title: “Meanminded owners who won't invest in improvements”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only good things about this horrible hotel are its location and friendly staff who deserve to work in a better establishment. The room I was given (for $150) was allegedly a Standard Double. It was tiny, poky, had no airconditioning. The tiles on the raised floor around the bed were badly chipped. The shower-bathroom (extremely outdated) had a broken tile. The TV is of a model decades old and the claim of satellite TV appears to be a total fabrication. Conditions were slightly better in the room I had after my protests over the first one, but not much. The breakfast provided was minimal. Fruit was canned, not fresh, sliced cheese of the cheapest processed sort and other items of poor quality. It is pretty obvious that the hotel owners, who presumably profit handsomely from Rome's extensive tourism, make NO attempt to upgrade the extremely out-of-date facilities. Decrepit rooms are NOT quaint or charming. I happened to be moving around Rome during my visit and stayed in other hotels--far, far nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awful beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Sant'Angelo for five nights in october 2005. Great location, very friendly staff, but the rooms .... beds and especially pillows were very hard, and altough the hotel is in a relatively quiet sidestreet there was still quite a bit of noise outside (the grabage collector came round at 1:30 a.m. ...). The use of the shower ment a large amount of water flowing into the room, nothing was done about this, even after several complaints. Well, an extra towel to mop up the water. For the rest, 10 minutes walk tot the Pantheon, Piazza Navona and St. Peters, the location doesn't leave much to desire.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for 3 nights in October. The location was great - on the Vatican side of the river - only 15 minutes walk to both the Vatican and Spanish Steps. The room was clean and hotel staff friendly. There was plenty of breakfast as you could eat as much as you liked. The hotel arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport when we were going home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Rome after a 24 hour plane ride from Australia, being a woman travelling alone, it was refreshing to be greeted so warmly by the family that run the hotel. Although located in quite a dark street and not being very well signed, having just a doorway as an entrance, I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel once you stepped out of the lift. The staff were very helpful and were able to answer any questions about the City. The rooms were a little basic but clean and quiet with air-conditioning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DGCHi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sant'Angelo with my partner in mid-June. I was rather dubious about the hotel as some of the reviews suggested it was run-down. However, on arrival I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, quaint room. Even though it was small, is was comfortable and there was absolutely no noise on an evening. The staff were very friendly and more than willing to help with any queries or provide suggestions of where to visit or dine on an evening. I would definitely recommend Piazza Novana for evening meals and drinks as it has such a lively but safe atmosphere. Hotel Sant'angelo is a great place to stay and added to the brilliant memories we now have of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: ctony
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sant'Angelo provided a very comfortable home base for our family's 1st foray into the Eternal City. Only complaint? A teensy-weeny shower stall. Other than that, the room, location, and friendly staff more than made up for that small inconvenience. Would definitely recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sant`Angelo for three nights in May 05. Ideal location for Vatican City (leave the hotel by 7.30am to avoid the masses) and many of the Rome sites. Recommend the open top bus tour to reduce the amount of walking. The room was simple with air conditioning but the bathroom must be one of the smallest we have encountered. Squeezing into the shower needed some dexterity and some of our american compatriots would have a severe problem. Also the plumbing is somewhat suspect resulting in potential flooding of the bathroom floor . The hotel reception is reached by the smallest lift in the world. Staff were courteous and the buffet breakfast adequate. As with all the hotels we visited in Italy, there were no tea/coffee facilities in the room and no mini-bar though I believe the hotel reception would arrange drinks if required. After visiting the customary outdoor restuarants, visit VICO`s in the side street adjacent to the hotel. Excellant food, very reasonable prices and pleasant staff. We think this Hotel is slightly overpriced and if we return to Rome, we would probably look around for an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful how and with whom you book”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff at the Hotel Sant Angelo were very helpful and spoke good english. We booked the hotel through Hotel Connect and although we saved a little I am sure we paid for it. In fact when I asked if this was true,at the hotel, I was told that the allocation of the rooms was influenced by this. Our room was on the 3rd floor at the back, which was fine as it was quieter, although the outlook pretty grim. The room was extremely small, the bedside table had to be to moved and the bed pulled out to get around the far side of the bed comfortably. The wall in the room was damp and tiles broken in the shower room. The basin leaked flooding the floor and a bath mat had been placed underneath to soak up the water, so they were aware of this fact. The plug did not work. A bulb in the bathroom had blown. All things were reported but nothing done and after further reports the bulb was replaced on the last day of our 4 night stay. Maybe we expected too much especially after seeing the pictures on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly decent hotel - that's all”
Reviews.Author: moshulu
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel with a good location, especially for visiting the Vatican. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the rooms are clean if uninsipred. Ok breakfast. For Rome, a slightly-better-than-average value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hotel Sant Angelo for 3 nights, and were really pleased, particularly with the location near the river. Our room was small (but I think others were larger) and the shower tiny, but perfectly adequate, and the staff were really helpful. I have given it 5 stars due to the price / location ratio, there were also a couple of nice restaurants and cafe's nearby. We didn't need to use public transport but walked a few miles a day seeing sights - tip - take comfy shoes, cobbles and heels don't go together! Overall, if you can get a good deal on this hotel, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a four night break at the Sant Angelo Hotel but on arrival moved to its sister hotel - Hotel Angel. Both the room and bathroom were perfect - clean and spacious. We had a short walk to Sant Angelo for our breakfast but that didnt spoil our stay, there was plenty of choice for breakfast. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Although down a side street it was ideally located for all the tourist attractions and being close to Castle Angelo and the Vatican always easy to find with good signs at the end of the street. Would recommend this hotel for a good value for money stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HelenC36
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in mid January with my family and can whole-heartedly recommend it.
