We actually stayed in the Hotel Angel (its sister hotel) and found its location perfect for sightseeing and eating out at night. It's only a short walk from the Vatican and nearby Trastavere and a pleasant stroll to the Forum and Colisseum. The staff were extremely helpful and recommended local restaurants and bars. The rooms were clean and well equipped and the shower was great. Breakfast is typical European continental. For the price it is well worth the money. One point when visiting Rome - don't eat around the Colisseum - very expensive and not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sant Angelo for 4 nights in December right after Christmas. The location was perfect. Some street noise but not too much. Fifteen minute walk to the Vatican and to the Spanish Steps. In fact we walked everywhere. You could not get lost since it was just adjacent to the Castel Sant Angelo and a couple of blocks from the Tiber. The reception workers were wonderful - incredibly helpful and kind. we arrived from the train station at 10:30 am and they gave us breakfast (no charge) and let us check int our room early. It's true that our shower was the smallest ever seen but we had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The room was clean altho just a bit worn. We had a great stay and would stay there again. Location was critical. The neighborhood had good restaurants, felt safe, a pharmacy across the street and cafes. What more could you ask for?!

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this hotel at all.”
Reviews.Author: hmsoapy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for 5 nights, and found it to be wonderful! I was a bit dubious at what to expect as we only paid £90 for 5 nights per person, but it was well worth the money. The hotel is very central to all sights, and we only needed to use public transport once. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and also gave us free air conditioning, which was superb. They speak good English too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone intending to stay in Rome. We absolutely loved it, especially for the location, and even more so because of the price!

Reviews.Title: “(Sant) Angel(o), a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Pat-and-Jan
Reviews.Content: After multiple inquiries via the web and our travel guides, we had become rather suspicious (and even desperate) concerning Rome hotels with a good price/quality quotient. Based a.o. on the Tripadvisor reviews and ranking, we finally chose hotel (Sant) Angel(o) - in fact some kind of 'twin' hotels located in the same street. We got a standard double room in the new part (Hotel Angel): clean, reasonable size, good bed, performant shower and very well isolated (a must in Rome if your room is on the street side). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast in a pleasant and quiet environment and was good with fair choice in buffet style. Location in Prati turned out to be very convenient in a calm and safe neighbourhood at equal and 10 minutes walking distance of Spanish stairs, Vatican and Piazza Navona. To our opinion, an excellent address for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well located about 10 minutes from St. Peter's and 15 minutes to the Spanish Steps. Very thin walls (could hear people in the next room talking) and almost unusably small shower. Room was good as was the price. The help was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sant Angelo / Angel /Good location acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubhed
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel thinking that we would be staying here. After bringing our lugage all the way up the stairs and checking in they said we would be staying at the same hote, but just down the street. So all four people gathered up our luggage and headed down the street. We latter found out that this was actually the hotel Angel, a seperate hotel. This is a very small hotel, but cozy. The staff was very friendly until checkout. The shower is veeeery small and the hot water only would last about 3-4 min. The air condition worked great as long as the room key was in the slot to operate. The beds are a sore point. They were made up to look like a double. We noticed I sagged on my side and my wife did not. We picked up the matress to find a cot holding up my side and a a small makeshift board holding up my wifes side. The house keeping was good and the rooms were clean. The bedspread had mysterious white crustations and other stains and spills on it. We did not use it. As other people have reported the location is excellent and the restaurant club 700 across the street was good and helpful. The bus 87 worked well to get to the colliseum and the forum. Everything else is walkable. The view from the room was nice of the alley outside. It was nice to lean out the window and people watch at night. The problem I refered to earlier was after we checked out I asked and I handed the man the key I asked if there was a restroom I could use while we wait for the bus. He told me no. He told me restrooms were for guest only. I thought he was kidding. So I said where can I go. He told me to walk down the street and find a place. And that was the last time we saw the hotel. So my final review of the hote would be if you get it for a really good price it is acceptable as a budget hotel. The only thing that would give it higher markes would be location. Did I say the location was great ???? It really was !!!! Happy Travels !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Convenient, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mdmomof7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at Hotel Sant Angelo. I booked this hotel for a group of 15 - 11 high school seniors and 4 female chaperones. We arrived quite late, about 11PM, after navigating the HOT, DIRTY Metro from the Termini. Mauro, the night clerk, welcomed us warmly even though he quickly realized we were a student group. I'm not sure they take groups, but he was very gracious to us. He was friendly in giving us instructions, specifically pointing out how to work the remote control for the AC, telling us where to get breakfast the next AM and where we could stow our luggage upon departure. Yes, it is a bit noisy coming into the marble lobby, and yes it's a small nuisance to be buzzed into the hotel after hours, but it was really no big deal at all. The breakfast was generous and the wait staff quiet but helpful. The price was absolutely right at 125Euros per night for a triple. The rooms were large, the bathrooms as well, but, yes, the shower was teeny. The hot water worked very well and the small shower could be simply managed by using the hand held shower. The location was great - near the Vatican and about 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps or the Piazza Navona. We preferred Piazza Navona to Campo Fiori in the evenings, but both were close. Friendly, convenient and affordable describe Hotel Sant Angelo. If you want a nice play to stay on a small budget, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners say...”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLuke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon where we stayed at the Hotel Sant’Angelo. The staff was very friendly and helpful and they could speak English. We stayed in RM111, which was good size, but the shower did not have hot water. We thought the water might get hotter but it didn’t. We talked to the hotel staff and they moved us to their sister hotel, Hotel Angel RM108, located on the same street. Hotel Angel has 11 rooms and is more up to date than Hotel Sant’Angelo and it had hot water. The air conditioning in the Hotel Angel was really nice, but the air conditioning in the Hotel Sant’Angelo was not nice. We could not figure out how to turn it on and it looked very old. The heating and air conditioning system in the newer Hotel Angel was very nice. The location is good where you can walk to the Vatican. You can take BUS 87 in the Piazza Cavour to the Colosseum and other sites. I would recommend closing the windows because the street noise is kind of loud, even thou the hotel is locate off the main streets. Plus, I would close the windows because the mosquitoes are terrible. The first night my wife was bitten up because we left the windows opened up. They must have not like my skin. The breakfast was nice and it was included in the price on the room. The Internet connection was fast and the price to use it was reasonable. Overall I would recommend this hotel to visitors of Roma, just make sure you get one of the 11 rooms in the newer Hotel Angel, unless you like cold water.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sant Angelo”
Reviews.Author: Saswa
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the hotel are not great, but stick with it and you will be impressed the location is absolutely fantastic and you can walk just about everywhere, its really close to plaza navona which is one of the best places to go at night in Rome. The bathrooms are small but very clean and tidy and the shower worked well. The AC also worked excellently in our room, breakfasts were great plenty to eat and the sweet filled croisants were delicious, the staff at the hotel were very helpful and polite. I get the impression that most of the hotels in Rome are of a very similar standard big old houses converted so definately go for the Sant Angelo if only for its location, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Yes - it really is good!”
Reviews.Author: World-roamer
Reviews.Content: This small hotel really does deserve the consistently high markings in your reviews. Location excellent, only 10 minutes walk to Spanish Steps or Piazza Navonne. There is a friendly staff, a good breakfast and clean, comfortable air conditioned rooms (you have to ask the receptionist for the rmote control). Would defintely recommend it for a good value stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was the fact that the air conditioner never worked in 95 degree July heat and humidity. Maybe it was the tiny bathroom with a coffin-sized shower. Maybe it was the room for 4 that was too small for 2. The location wasn't bad and the staff was pleasant but it just didn't make up for all the other issues. Definitely wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Come to your home away from home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: kappachino
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a pleasant experience. I stayed during the first week of June 2004 and I have to say NEVER have I had such a pleasant stay with warm and gracious people who worked there who seemed genuinely happy to talk to you and get to know you. It totally made our week. OK let's talk about the actual hotel. Used to be someone's home years back, you walk into the breezeway of the gated building, with tall arching ceiling and a statue of Athena by the doorway. Awesome. Rooms were nice, very homey, shower albeit could be bigger, but we are used to having a lot of space (especially here in Texas) so I can rough it. Breakfast was really nice. You have fresh pastries (gotta try to cornetto), cereal, assortment of lunch meats (salami, prosciutto, ham di Parma) and provolone cheese, yogurt, juices, and a cappucino bar where the sweet attendants there will come by and ask what you would like to drink and chat with you. I had freshly made cappuccino every morning. Awesome. The desk attendants were very helpful and friendly, giving tips on where to go to see various places. We'd always chat, that was cool. They speak excellent English so don't worry. We wanted to go on a tour of the Roman countryside, and told the front desk and promptly he arranged for the tour. The location of the hotel was also good. Steps away from Piazza Cavour, and 15 minute walk to the Vatican. Very handy ATM machine right by the hotel along with several nice eateries. Thanks for making my stay in Rome such a wonderful one. I would definitely consider staying at the Hotel Sant' Angelo again if I went back to Rome!!! You will too!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 3-star Sant'Angelo for 5 glorious days from May 31-June 5, 2004, in room 204 ( a room with two twin beds). I would recommend this place to anyone, and am looking forward to going back! The building is a historic palazzo, and the dramatic entryway features massive wooden doors, marble flooring, potted plants, and even a resident statue of Athena. Reception is on the first floor (second floor to Americans), with a fantastically painted lounge with Internet service. The rooms are lovely -- I loved hanging out over my mini-balcony in the mornings -- though I should point out that there are shower boxes only in the sparkling marble bathrooms, not full bathtubs. The breakfast is delicious (the hot cornetti were always a treat); the coffee bar makes you your morning coffee to order, and by week's end, the charming staff were bringing me cappuccino without me even asking. Location is perfect -- just across the Tiber from Piazza Navona and really within walking distance of most places; there is great public transportation just a few steps away. The Sant'Angelo overall is a great place, but it is the staff that really makes this place special: it was the absolute BEST customer service I have ever had, and I've traveled extensively. Claudio, Mauro, and all the other good folks there area true joy, and by the time I left, I felt like I was leaving old friends. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I relied on all the reviews on this great website to choose this hotel and it was fantastic! The location was fabulous - walking distance to everything - the Castel Sant Angelo, Spanish Steps, Shopping Area etc.. The staff was very friendly, and helpful. The hotel had a lot of charm and character and beautiful antique furniture. It was nice that the breakfast was also included. It was a great value and I would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in late April of 2004. The location is fabulous, just a 15 minute walk to St. Peter's and the Vatican and very close to the bus lines which took us to the Colosseum. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and speaks excellent English. The pickup service at the airport was terrific - definitely take advantage of this. The hotel is small and quaint, not overly large restrooms. But the staff is excellent and they have a very nice breakfast with awesome latte's. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Noms2000
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with extremely friendly staff. The entrance looks like a prison and the lift is very small, but its worth it. The hallways and stairs are quite dark and scary. The room and bathroom was a bit small and the floor was tiled instead of carpeted, which made it a bit cold. The plus point was that the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. The location is near the Piazza Cavour where you can get a taxi very easily. The train station Termini is quite far and NOT within walking distance. The local restaurants are brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband , myself and two children stayed for 4 nights. The hotel was clean and comfortable ( the shower was a little on the small side) and the staff were excellent, taking time to advise us all aspects of Rome. The hotel is situated in a quiet street and is in a great location with bus stops nearby and offers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for a weekend, and we loved it! Great location and price - and the rooms and hospitality of the staff was super! Good english speaking as well! Don't hesitate to use this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, across the street from a small and clean market. Neighborhood cafes are clean and reasonably priced. Truely within walking distance of the Vatican. 2 blocks from Piazza Cavour, taxi station and bus stop. Rome is a noisy city and this hotel is located on a quiet back street. The staff were polite and very helpful, and honest. I accidentally left my purse( in the breakfast room) with over $1,000. cash and my passport, they turned it into the front desk. Not one dollar was missing. That wouldn't happen too many places. The hotel is clean and security good. The rooms are of average size by European standards, the bathroom small but very clean. Breakfast is a small ( but, all you can eat ) buffet of FRESH baked goods, cereal, yogart, juice. Coffee is made to order. I HIGHLY reccommend the airport pickup service, you have a uniformed driver waiting at the arrival area, holding a sign with your name on it. Our driver even waited over an hour as our plane was late. It is a first class service. We negotiated a room rate directly through the hotel via e-mail, better rate than any of the on-line services. Rome is an expensive place to visit, Hotel Sant Angelo offers a clean and affordable place to stay. I'd rather spend the big bucks on other things. The free tickets to the Wednesday Papal Audience really does exist and they arranged it beautifully. We stayed for 2 weeks in Nov. 2003 and would definently stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sant Angelo
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marianna Dionigi 16 | Vatican area, 00193 Rome, Italy
